001package gbw.melange.common.events.observability.filters;
002
003/**
004 * <p>IFilterChain interface.</p>
005 *
006 * @param <T> type of filter, either failing, which is okay, or pristine.
007 * @param <R> type of identifier for each filter, managed by the given IFilterChain implementation. If not explicitly given, the equality function used between identifiers will be object equivalence.
008 * @author GustavBW
009 * @version $Id: $Id
010 */
011public interface IFilterChain<T, R> {
012    /**
013     * Adds a filter to the chain
014     *
015     * @return the assigned identifier for that filter.
016     * @param filter a T object
017     */
018    R addFilter(T filter);
019
020    /**
021     * When trying to add the filter to the chain, the identifier specified might be occupied in which case this method will do nothing. <br/>
022     * To replace an existing filter, use {@link gbw.melange.common.events.observability.filters.IFilterChain#replaceFilter(R, T)} instead
023     *
024     * @return the resulting identifier
025     * @param filter a T object
026     * @param identifier a R object
027     */
028    R addFilter(T filter, R identifier);
029
030    /**
031     * Replaces an existing filter by the given id if it exists.
032     *
033     * @return Whether a filter was replaced or not.
034     * @param identifier a R object
035     * @param filter a T object
036     */
037    boolean replaceFilter(R identifier, T filter);
038
039    /**
040     * <p>removeFilter.</p>
041     *
042     * @return Whether a filter was removed or not.
043     * @param filter a T object
044     */
045    boolean removeFilter(T filter);
046
047    /**
048     * <p>removeOnId.</p>
049     *
050     * @return Whether a filter was removed or not.
051     * @param identifier a R object
052     */
053    boolean removeOnId(R identifier);
054
055    /**
056     * <p>contains.</p>
057     *
058     * @return True if the filter chain currently contains the provider filter.
059     * @param filter a T object
060     */
061    boolean contains(T filter);
062    /**
063     * <p>containsById.</p>
064     *
065     * @return True if the filter chain currently contains a filter with that id.
066     * @param identifier a R object
067     */
068    boolean containsById(R identifier);
069}
